extracted_data.article_text:
THE DIGITAL PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION ACT, 2023
(NO. 22 OF 2023)
[11th August, 2023.]
An Act to provide for the processing of digital personal data in a manner that
recognises both the right of individuals to protect their personal data and the
need to process such personal data for lawful purposes and for matters
connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Seventy-fourth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:––
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY
1. (1) This Act may be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
(2)  It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification
in the Official Gazette, appoint and different dates may be appointed for different provisions
of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall
be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.

extracted_data.requirement: This Act shall be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The official title of the Act is the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.

controls.control: Establish a comprehensive data protection policy that outlines the organization's commitment to protecting personal data, data collection and usage practices, and procedures for handling data breaches.

Classify personal data into different categories based on its sensitivity and risk level, and implement appropriate controls to protect each category, such as encryption, access controls, and data retention policies.

Implement a transparent and informed data collection process that obtains explicit consent from individuals before collecting their personal data, and provide clear information about data usage and sharing practices.
Implement role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, and regularly review and update access permissions to prevent unauthorized access.
Implement secure data storage and transmission practices, such as encryption, secure socket layer (SSL) or transport layer security (TLS) protocols, and regular backups to prevent data loss.

Establish a data breach notification process that promptly informs affected individuals and regulatory authorities in the event of a data breach, and provides clear information about the breach and mitigation measures.

Implement data retention and disposal policies that ensure personal data is retained only for as long as necessary, and disposed of securely when no longer needed, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

Implement procedures to facilitate data subject rights, such as access, correction, and erasure, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, and provide clear information about these rights to individuals.

Provide regular data protection training to employees and contractors to ensure they understand the organization's data protection policies and procedures, and are aware of their roles and responsibilities in protecting personal data.

Promote data protection awareness among employees, customers, and partners through various channels, such as posters, email campaigns, and social media, to encourage a culture of data protection within the organization.

extracted_data.requirement: The Act shall come into force on a date appointed by the Central Government.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Act will come into effect on a date specified by the Central Government, which may be different for different provisions.

controls.control: The Central Government shall define the effective date of the Act in a gazette notification, which shall be published at least 30 days prior to the appointed date. This will ensure that all stakeholders are aware of the upcoming implementation date.

The Central Government shall develop a transition plan to ensure a smooth implementation of the Act. This plan shall include timelines, milestones, and resource allocation to ensure that all necessary steps are taken to meet the effective date.

The Central Government shall communicate the effective date of the Act to all stakeholders, including citizens, businesses, and other government agencies. This can be done through various channels, such as public announcements, social media, and official websites.

The Central Government shall ensure that the Act does not conflict with existing laws and regulations. This shall involve a thorough review of all relevant laws and regulations to ensure that the Act is compliant and does not create any unintended consequences.

The Central Government shall establish a monitoring and review mechanism to track the progress of the Act's implementation. This shall involve regular reviews and assessments to ensure that the Act is being implemented as intended and to identify any areas for improvement.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Establishment of the Data Protection Board of India
extracted_data.requirement: The Central Government shall establish the Data Protection Board of India under section 18.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Central Government is required to establish the Data Protection Board of India, which is a critical component of the data protection framework.

controls.control_title: Establish Data Protection Board of India
controls.control: The Central Government shall establish the Data Protection Board of India under section 18, with a clear mandate to oversee and enforce data protection laws and regulations in the country. The Board shall be composed of experts in data protection, law, and technology, and shall have the authority to investigate data breaches, impose penalties on non-compliant organizations, and provide guidance on data protection best practices.

The Central Government shall define the Board's mandate and responsibilities, including its powers, duties, and functions, in accordance with section 18. This shall include the Board's role in overseeing the implementation of data protection laws and regulations, investigating data breaches, and providing guidance on data protection best practices.

The Central Government shall ensure that the Data Protection Board of India operates independently and autonomously, free from undue influence or interference from any government agency or organization. This shall include ensuring that the Board has the necessary resources, funding, and personnel to carry out its functions effectively.

The Central Government shall establish clear decision-making processes for the Data Protection Board of India, including procedures for making decisions on data breaches, imposing penalties on non-compliant organizations, and providing guidance on data protection best practices. This shall ensure that decisions are made in a transparent, fair, and consistent manner.

The Central Government shall provide the Data Protection Board of India with adequate resources and funding to carry out its functions effectively, including personnel, equipment, and technology. This shall ensure that the Board has the necessary capacity to investigate data breaches, impose penalties on non-compliant organizations, and provide guidance on data protection best practices.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Appointment of a Data Protection Officer
extracted_data.requirement: A Significant Data Fiduciary shall appoint a Data Protection Officer under section 10.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Significant Data Fiduciary is required to appoint a Data Protection Officer, who will be responsible for ensuring compliance with data protection regulations.

controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who is responsible for overseeing the organization's data protection practices and ensuring compliance with relevant data protection laws and regulations. The DPO shall be appointed under section 10 and shall have the necessary authority and resources to perform their duties effectively.

controls.control_title: Define the DPO's Role and Responsibilities
controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall define the role and responsibilities of the Data Protection Officer, including their duties, authorities, and reporting lines. This shall be documented in a clear and concise manner and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

The Data Protection Officer shall be independent and impartial in their decision-making and shall not be influenced by any external factors. The Significant Data Fiduciary shall ensure that the DPO has the necessary autonomy to perform their duties without interference or undue influence.

controls.control_title: Provide Training and Resources to the DPO
controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall provide the Data Protection Officer with the necessary training, resources, and support to perform their duties effectively. This shall include access to relevant data protection laws and regulations, as well as training on data protection best practices.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review the DPO's Performance
controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall regularly monitor and review the performance of the Data Protection Officer to ensure that they are meeting their responsibilities and obligations. This shall include regular reporting and feedback to the DPO and the Significant Data Fiduciary.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Registration with the Data Protection Board of India
extracted_data.requirement: A Consent Manager shall be registered with the Data Protection Board of India.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Consent Manager, who acts as a single point of contact for Data Principals, must be registered with the Data Protection Board of India.

controls.control_title: Register Consent Manager with Data Protection Board of India
controls.control: The organization shall register the Consent Manager with the Data Protection Board of India within 30 days of its implementation. This registration shall be done through the official portal of the Data Protection Board of India.

controls.control_title: Maintain Records of Consent Manager Registration
controls.control: The organization shall maintain accurate and up-to-date records of the Consent Manager's registration with the Data Protection Board of India. These records shall include the registration date, registration number, and any subsequent updates or amendments.
The organization shall verify the status of the Consent Manager's registration with the Data Protection Board of India on a quarterly basis to ensure that it remains compliant with the regulations.

controls.control_title: Designate a Compliance Officer for Consent Manager
controls.control: The organization shall designate a Compliance Officer responsible for ensuring the Consent Manager's compliance with the Data Protection Board of India's regulations. This officer shall be responsible for monitoring the Consent Manager's registration status and ensuring that any necessary updates or amendments are made in a timely manner.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Processing of personal data in digital form
extracted_data.requirement: Personal data shall be processed in digital form.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Personal data must be processed in digital form, which implies that digital personal data is the primary form of personal data under this Act.

controls.control: Implement secure digital data storage systems that are designed to handle personal data, such as databases or cloud storage solutions. Ensure that these systems are regularly updated and patched to prevent security vulnerabilities.

Implement end-to-end encryption for all digital data, including data at rest and data in transit. This will ensure that personal data is protected from unauthorized access, even in the event of a data breach.

Develop and implement procedures for processing personal data in digital form, including guidelines for data collection, storage, and transmission. Ensure that these procedures are communicated to all personnel who handle personal data.

Conduct regular audits of digital data processing systems to ensure compliance with data protection regulations and to identify areas for improvement. This will help to detect and prevent data breaches.

Provide regular training to personnel on the proper handling and processing of personal data in digital form. This will help to ensure that personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in protecting personal data.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Automated processing of data
extracted_data.requirement: Data shall be processed using automated means.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data must be processed using automated means, which implies that manual processing is not allowed under this Act.

controls.control: Establish a policy that outlines the use of automated means for data processing. This policy should include guidelines for data processing, data quality, and data security.

controls.control_title: Automated Data Processing Tools and Software
controls.control: Implement and maintain a list of approved automated data processing tools and software. Ensure that all tools and software are regularly updated and patched to prevent security vulnerabilities.

Provide regular training to employees on the use of automated data processing tools and software. Ensure that employees understand the importance of data quality and security when using automated means.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation on automated data processing procedures, including data flow diagrams and system architecture.

controls.control_title: Automated Data Processing Audits and Reviews
controls.control: Regularly conduct audits and reviews of automated data processing systems to ensure compliance with the policy and to identify areas for improvement.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Data Fiduciary's responsibility for data processing
extracted_data.requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall determine the purpose and means of processing personal data.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Data Fiduciary is responsible for determining the purpose and means of processing personal data, which implies that they must take an active role in data processing decisions.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall document and communicate the specific purposes for which personal data is being processed. This includes identifying the primary and secondary purposes for data collection, storage, and use.

controls.control_title: Conduct Data Mapping and Impact Assessments
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall conduct regular data mapping and impact assessments to identify the means of processing personal data, including data flows, storage locations, and third-party vendors. This will help identify potential risks and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

The Data Fiduciary shall establish a data governance framework that outlines the roles, responsibilities, and policies for data processing. This framework should include guidelines for data quality, security, and retention, as well as procedures for data subject requests and complaints.

The Data Fiduciary shall provide clear and concise information to data subjects about the purposes and means of processing their personal data. This includes providing a data protection policy, data subject rights, and contact information for data protection inquiries.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Data Processing Activities
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall regularly review and update data processing activities to ensure they remain necessary and proportionate to the purposes for which personal data is being processed. This includes monitoring changes in business operations, technology, and regulatory requirements.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Data Processor's responsibility for data processing
extracted_data.requirement: A Data Processor shall process personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Data Processor is responsible for processing personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary, which implies that they must act in accordance with the instructions of the Data Fiduciary.

controls.control: The Data Processor shall have a written Data Processing Agreement (DPA) in place with the Data Fiduciary that outlines the terms and conditions of data processing, including the purposes of processing, duration, and security measures.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: The Data Processor shall implement data protection by design and default principles, ensuring that personal data is processed in a way that is secure, transparent, and compliant with applicable laws and regulations.

The Data Processor shall implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, and that access is granted on a need-to-know basis, with clear roles and responsibilities defined.
The Data Processor shall ensure that personal data is transferred and stored securely, using encryption and other appropriate measures to protect against unauthorized access or breaches.

The Data Processor shall be able to demonstrate compliance with data subject rights, including the right to access, rectification, erasure, and objection to processing, as required by applicable laws and regulations.

The Data Processor shall have a data breach notification process in place, which includes notifying the Data Fiduciary and relevant authorities in the event of a breach, as required by applicable laws and regulations.
The Data Processor shall have a data disposal process in place, which includes securely disposing of personal data at the end of its retention period, as required by applicable laws and regulations.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Data Protection Officer's role in data protection
extracted_data.requirement: A Data Protection Officer shall be responsible for ensuring compliance with data protection regulations.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Data Protection Officer is responsible for ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, which implies that they must take an active role in monitoring and enforcing data protection practices within the organization.

controls.control: Appoint a qualified and experienced Data Protection Officer (DPO) who is responsible for ensuring compliance with data protection regulations. The DPO should have the necessary skills, knowledge, and authority to perform their duties effectively.

Clearly define the roles and responsibilities of all employees and stakeholders in relation to data protection. This includes ensuring that all employees understand their obligations and the consequences of non-compliance.

Develop a comprehensive data protection policy that outlines the organization's approach to data protection. The policy should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure it remains relevant and effective.
Provide regular data protection training to all employees to ensure they understand their obligations and the organization's data protection policies and procedures.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all data protection activities, including data subject requests, data breaches, and compliance audits. These records should be retained for a minimum of 5 years.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Digital office for proceedings
extracted_data.requirement: Proceedings shall be conducted in a digital office.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Proceedings must be conducted in a digital office, which implies that all interactions and communications related to data protection shall be conducted online or in digital mode.

controls.control: Implement a secure and reliable digital office infrastructure, including hardware, software, and network components, to support digital proceedings. This includes ensuring that all systems are up-to-date, patched, and configured to meet security standards.

Implement robust access control and authentication mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel can access digital proceedings. This includes multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, and secure password management.

controls.control_title: Digital Proceeding Data Backup and Recovery
controls.control: Develop and implement a data backup and recovery plan to ensure that digital proceeding data is protected against loss or corruption. This includes regular backups, data encryption, and a disaster recovery plan.
Implement data encryption mechanisms to protect digital proceeding data in transit and at rest. This includes using secure protocols such as HTTPS and encrypting data stored on servers and devices.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of digital proceedings, including meeting minutes, decisions, and actions. This includes using a document management system to store and track documents.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for personnel involved in digital proceedings to ensure they understand the importance of digital office security and best practices for conducting digital proceedings.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Consent Manager's role in consent management
extracted_data.requirement: A Consent Manager shall enable Data Principals to give, manage, review, and withdraw their consent through an accessible, transparent, and interoperable platform.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Consent Manager is responsible for enabling Data Principals to give, manage, review, and withdraw their consent through an accessible, transparent, and interoperable platform, which implies that they must provide a user-friendly interface for consent management.

controls.control: The Consent Manager shall provide an accessible user interface that can be used by Data Principals with disabilities, adhering to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA standards.

The Consent Manager shall provide clear and concise information about the data being collected, the purposes of collection, and the rights of Data Principals to give, manage, review, and withdraw their consent.
The Consent Manager shall enable seamless integration with other systems and platforms, allowing for the exchange of consent information in a standardized and machine-readable format.
The Consent Manager shall implement robust user authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure that only authorized Data Principals can access and manage their consent information.
The Consent Manager shall maintain detailed audit trails and logs of all consent-related activities, including changes to consent status, to facilitate compliance and accountability.

The Consent Manager shall provide a user feedback mechanism that allows Data Principals to report any issues or concerns related to the consent process, enabling the organization to identify areas for improvement.

The Consent Manager shall provide regular reporting on consent status, including metrics on consent rates, withdrawal rates, and other relevant data, to support organizational decision-making and compliance.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Applicability of the Act
extracted_data.requirement: The Act shall apply to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India where the personal data is collected.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data collected within India, including data collected in digital or non-digital form and subsequently digitized.

controls.control: Define a clear geographic boundary within the territory of India where personal data is collected. This boundary should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.
Identify and document all points within the defined geographic boundary where personal data is collected, including but not limited to, websites, mobile applications, and physical locations.

Implement a consent mechanism to obtain explicit consent from data subjects before collecting their personal data within the defined geographic boundary. This consent mechanism should be transparent, easily accessible, and easy to understand.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all personal data collected within the defined geographic boundary, including but not limited to, data subject information, collection methods, and purposes of collection.

Regularly monitor and review the data collection process to ensure it is operating within the defined geographic boundary and in compliance with the Act. This includes but is not limited to, conducting audits and risk assessments.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Applicability of the Act outside India
extracted_data.requirement: The Act shall also apply to processing of digital personal data outside the territory of India, if such processing is in connection with any activity related to offering of goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data outside India if it is related to offering goods or services to individuals within India.

controls.control_title: Conduct a Risk Assessment for Cross-Border Data Processing
controls.control: The organization shall conduct a risk assessment to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing digital personal data outside the territory of India. This risk assessment shall consider factors such as data protection laws and regulations in the relevant jurisdictions, data transfer mechanisms, and the potential impact on Data Principals.

The organization shall implement data transfer agreements with third-party processors or controllers outside the territory of India to ensure that they comply with the Act and relevant data protection laws and regulations. These agreements shall include provisions for data protection, security, and liability.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Data Protection Laws and Regulations
controls.control: The organization shall ensure that it complies with data protection laws and regulations in the relevant jurisdictions where digital personal data is processed outside the territory of India. This includes obtaining necessary approvals, registrations, and certifications as required by law.

The organization shall maintain accurate and up-to-date records of its cross-border data processing activities, including the types of data processed, the countries where data is processed, and the measures taken to ensure compliance with the Act and relevant data protection laws and regulations.

controls.control_title: Train Personnel on Cross-Border Data Processing
controls.control: The organization shall provide regular training to its personnel on the requirements and implications of cross-border data processing, including the Act and relevant data protection laws and regulations. This training shall ensure that personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in ensuring compliance.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Personal Data
extracted_data.requirement: Personal data means any data about an individual who is identifiable by or in relation to such data.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Personal data refers to any information that can be used to identify an individual.

controls.control: Collect and store only the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. This includes implementing data retention policies and procedures to ensure data is not stored for longer than necessary.
Anonymize personal data whenever possible, especially when storing or transferring data. This can be achieved through techniques such as pseudonymization, encryption, or data masking.

Implement procedures for individuals to access, correct, or delete their personal data upon request. This includes providing clear instructions on how to submit requests and ensuring timely responses.

Integrate data protection principles into the design and development of systems, products, and services that collect, store, or process personal data. This includes conducting data protection impact assessments (DPIAs) and implementing data protection by default.

Maintain an up-to-date inventory of personal data stored, processed, or transmitted by the organization. This includes identifying data types, sources, and purposes, as well as data storage locations and retention periods.
Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the importance of protecting personal data, including data handling procedures, data breaches, and incident response.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Personal Data Breach
extracted_data.requirement: A personal data breach means any unauthorized processing or accidental disclosure of personal data that compromises confidentiality, integrity, or availability.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A personal data breach occurs when personal data is processed or disclosed without authorization, or when there is an accidental loss or compromise of personal data.

controls.control: Develop and implement an incident response plan that includes procedures for responding to personal data breaches. The plan should outline roles and responsibilities, communication protocols, and containment and eradication procedures.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Security Audits and Risk Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular security audits and risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and potential weaknesses in the processing of personal data. This will help to identify potential risks and take corrective action to mitigate them.

Provide regular training to staff on data protection and the importance of maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of personal data. This should include training on how to identify and report potential data breaches.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data. This should include implementing role-based access controls, password policies, and two-factor authentication.

Implement monitoring systems to detect and alert on unusual activity that may indicate a potential data breach. This should include monitoring for suspicious login attempts, data access, and other security-related events.
Implement data encryption to protect personal data in transit and at rest. This should include encrypting data stored on devices, in databases, and during transmission over networks.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Processing
extracted_data.requirement: Processing means any automated operation or set of operations performed on digital personal data, including collection, recording, and disclosure.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Processing refers to any automated operation or set of operations performed on digital personal data, including various activities such as collection, recording, and disclosure.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough impact assessment to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing digital personal data. This includes identifying the type of data being processed, the purpose of processing, and the potential consequences of a data breach.

Only collect, record, and disclose the minimum amount of digital personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. This includes implementing data retention policies and procedures to ensure data is not stored longer than necessary.

Implement robust data encryption measures to protect digital personal data in transit and at rest. This includes using industry-standard encryption protocols and ensuring that encryption keys are securely managed.

Implement role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to digital personal data. This includes implementing authentication and authorization procedures to prevent unauthorized access.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of all data processing activities, including data collection, recording, and disclosure. This includes documenting data processing procedures, data retention policies, and data subject rights.

Establish procedures for notifying data subjects of data processing activities, including the purpose of processing, the types of data being processed, and the rights of data subjects. This includes providing clear and concise information to data subjects.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Significant Data Fiduciary
extracted_data.requirement: A Significant Data Fiduciary is any Data Fiduciary or class of Data Fiduciaries notified by the Central Government under section 10.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Significant Data Fiduciary is a Data Fiduciary or class of Data Fiduciaries designated by the Central Government under section 10.

controls.control: Establish a process to receive and acknowledge notifications from the Central Government under section 10. This process should include clear roles and responsibilities, timelines for response, and documentation of all notifications received.

Maintain a record of all notifications received from the Central Government under section 10. This record should include the date of notification, the class of Data Fiduciaries notified, and any actions taken in response to the notification.

Communicate notifications received from the Central Government under section 10 to all relevant parties, including Data Fiduciaries within the notified class. This communication should include clear instructions on the actions required in response to the notification.

Review and update the process for receiving and responding to notifications from the Central Government under section 10 on a regular basis. This review should include assessing the effectiveness of the process and identifying areas for improvement.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Specified Purpose
extracted_data.requirement: A specified purpose means the purpose mentioned in the notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A specified purpose refers to the purpose mentioned in the notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal, as required by the Act and its rules.

controls.control_title: Clearly Define the Purpose of Data Collection
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must clearly define the purpose of data collection in the notice given to the Data Principal. This purpose must be specific, concise, and easily understandable by the Data Principal. The purpose must also be aligned with the legitimate interests of the Data Fiduciary.

controls.control_title: Obtain Explicit Consent for Data Collection
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before collecting their data. This consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous. The Data Fiduciary must also provide the Data Principal with the option to withdraw their consent at any time.

controls.control_title: Document the Purpose of Data Collection
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must maintain a record of the purpose of data collection, including the notice given to the Data Principal. This record must be easily accessible and up-to-date. The Data Fiduciary must also ensure that the record is accurate and complete.

controls.control_title: Review and Update the Purpose of Data Collection
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must regularly review and update the purpose of data collection to ensure that it remains relevant and accurate. This review must be conducted at least annually, or as required by law or regulation.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Personal Data Processing for Lawful Purpose
extracted_data.article_text:
4 THE GAZETTE OF INDIA EXTRAORDINARY [P ART II—

(i) personal data processed by an individual for any personal or domestic
purpose; and
(ii) personal data that is made or caused to be made publicly available
by—
(A) the Data Principal to whom such personal data relates; or
(B) any other person who is under an obligation under any law for

available.

data on social media. In such case, the provisions of this Act shall not apply.
CHAPTER II
OBLIGATIONS OF DATA FIDUCIARY

controls.control_title: Notice to Data Principal Before Processing Personal Data
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide a clear and concise notice to the Data Principal before processing their personal data for consent. This notice shall include information about the purpose of data processing, the types of data to be processed, and the duration for which the data will be stored.

The notice to the Data Principal shall be provided at the earliest opportunity before processing their personal data, ideally at the point of data collection or as soon as possible after data collection.

The notice to the Data Principal shall include the following information: (1) a clear statement of the purpose of data processing, (2) a description of the types of personal data to be processed, (3) an explanation of how the data will be used, (4) information about the duration for which the data will be stored, and (5) contact information for the Data Fiduciary.
The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of the notice provided to the Data Principal, including the date and time of notice, the method of notice, and the content of the notice.
The notice to the Data Principal shall be provided in a language and format that is easily understandable by the Data Principal. The notice shall be clear, concise, and free from technical jargon.

controls.control: Implement an automated system to generate and send notices to Data Principals when their personal data is processed. This system should be integrated with the data processing systems to ensure timely and accurate notifications.

Develop a secure and user-friendly DSAR portal that allows Data Principals to request information about their personal data processing. The portal should provide a clear and concise way for Data Principals to submit their requests and track the status of their requests.

Establish clear guidelines for the content and format of the notice to be provided to Data Principals. The notice should include information about the types of personal data processed, the purposes of processing, and the rights of Data Principals. The notice should be easily accessible and understandable by Data Principals.

Develop a process to distribute the notice to Data Principals in a timely and efficient manner. This may include email, postal mail, or other electronic means, depending on the preferences of the Data Principals.
Implement a process to track and record acknowledgement of receipt of the notice by Data Principals. This can be done through a confirmation email or a checkbox on the DSAR portal.

extracted_data.requirement: Personal data shall not be processed without consent or a lawful purpose.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Personal data cannot be processed without the Data Principal's consent or if it is for a purpose that is not forbidden by law.

controls.control_title: Obtain Explicit Consent from Data Subjects
controls.control: Ensure that explicit consent is obtained from data subjects before processing their personal data. This includes providing clear and concise information about the purpose of data collection, storage, and processing, as well as obtaining affirmative consent through a clear and unambiguous action (e.g., ticking a box or signing a document).

controls.control_title: Define and Document Lawful Purposes for Data Processing
controls.control: Establish and document the lawful purposes for processing personal data, including the specific reasons for data collection, storage, and processing. This documentation should be accessible to all personnel involved in data processing and should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with changing regulations and requirements.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data. This includes implementing role-based access controls, using secure authentication and authorization mechanisms, and regularly reviewing and updating access permissions to ensure that they remain necessary and appropriate.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular data protection impact assessments (DPIAs) to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing personal data. This includes assessing the likelihood and potential impact of data breaches, identifying measures to mitigate these risks, and implementing controls to prevent or minimize the effects of a breach.

Provide clear and concise information to data subjects about their rights under applicable data protection regulations, including the right to access, rectify, erase, restrict processing, object to processing, and data portability. This information should be easily accessible and should be provided in a format that is clear and understandable to the data subject.

extracted_data.requirement_description: A Data Fiduciary must inform the Data Principal about how to exercise her rights and how to make a complaint to the Board.

controls.control_title: Clear and Prominent Disclosure of Rights
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall display a clear and prominent notice on their website and mobile application, informing the Data Principal about their rights and the complaint procedure. This notice shall be easily accessible and shall be displayed in a manner that is clear and understandable to the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a document that outlines the Data Principal's rights and the complaint procedure. This document shall be easily accessible to the Data Principal and shall be updated regularly to reflect any changes to the Data Principal's rights or the complaint procedure.

The Data Fiduciary shall provide regular training to their staff on the Data Principal's rights and the complaint procedure. This training shall ensure that all staff members are aware of their responsibilities and obligations under the Data Fiduciary's obligations to the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a document that outlines the complaint procedure, including the steps that the Data Principal can take to lodge a complaint and the timeframe for resolving complaints. This document shall be easily accessible to the Data Principal and shall be updated regularly to reflect any changes to the complaint procedure.

The Data Fiduciary shall obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before collecting, processing, or sharing their personal data. This consent shall be informed and shall be obtained in a manner that is clear and understandable to the Data Principal.

Clearly communicate the Data Principal's right to withdraw consent through various channels, such as the website, mobile app, email, and marketing materials. This ensures that Data Principals are aware of their rights and can exercise them easily.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of the Data Principal's consent withdrawal, including the date and time of withdrawal, and any subsequent actions taken. This will help to demonstrate compliance with the requirement and provide a clear audit trail.

controls.control: Regularly review and update the consent withdrawal process to ensure it remains effective and compliant with the requirement. This should include monitoring for any changes in laws or regulations that may impact the process.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a log of all notices sent to Data Principals, including the date and time of the notice, the content of the notice, and the method of delivery. This log shall be easily accessible and auditable.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all consents given by Data Principals, including the date and time of the consent, the type of data being processed, and the method of consent. This record shall be easily accessible and auditable.

The Data Fiduciary shall verify that notices were delivered to the intended Data Principals, using methods such as email delivery receipts, SMS delivery reports, or postal delivery confirmation. This verification shall be documented and retained for a minimum of 6 months.

The Data Fiduciary shall validate that consents given by Data Principals are genuine and not coerced, using methods such as two-factor authentication or human review of consent forms. This validation shall be documented and retained for a minimum of 6 months.
The Data Fiduciary shall retain records of notices and consents for a minimum of 6 months, in case of any disputes or audits. These records shall be easily accessible and securely stored.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must specify the purpose for which the Data Principal's personal data will be processed at the time of data collection. This purpose must be clearly communicated to the Data Principal and must not be used for any other purpose without the Data Principal's consent.
The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before processing their personal data for any purpose. This consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.

The Data Fiduciary must use a data collection form that clearly specifies the purpose for which the Data Principal's personal data will be processed. The form must also provide an opportunity for the Data Principal to opt-out of data processing.
The Data Fiduciary must review and update the purpose for which the Data Principal's personal data is being processed on a regular basis to ensure that it remains accurate and relevant.

The Data Fiduciary must ensure that access to the Data Principal's personal data is restricted to authorized personnel and that the data is retained only for the specified purpose and for a limited period of time.

Establish a data retention and disposal policy for personal data collected and processed for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits. Ensure that data is retained for the minimum period necessary and disposed of securely when no longer needed.

Implement procedures to enable individuals to access their personal data collected and processed for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits. Provide individuals with the opportunity to correct or update their data if it is inaccurate or incomplete.

Implement measures to protect personal data collected and processed for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction. controls.control: Immediately cease all data processing activities related to emailing bills for Z's personal data. This includes stopping all automated processes, terminating any running scripts, and disabling any scheduled tasks.

controls.control_title: Notify Relevant Parties of Data Processing Cessation
controls.control: Notify all relevant parties, including but not limited to, Y, Z, and any third-party vendors involved in the emailing process, of the immediate cessation of data processing activities for Z's personal data.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Data Processing Documentation
controls.control: Review and update all relevant documentation, including but not limited to, data processing agreements, consent forms, and system documentation, to reflect the cessation of data processing activities for Z's personal data.

Verify that all data processing activities related to emailing bills for Z's personal data have been successfully ceased. This includes monitoring system logs, reviewing data processing schedules, and conducting regular audits to ensure compliance.

Implement data access controls to prevent unauthorized access to Z's personal data. This includes revoking access permissions for all personnel who no longer require access to the data and implementing role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access the data.

Conduct data disposal procedures to ensure that all personal data related to Z is properly disposed of in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. This includes securely deleting or destroying all physical and electronic copies of the data.

controls.control: Maintain a centralized repository of all policies issued by the Central Government related to personal data processing. Ensure that all policies are easily accessible and up-to-date.

Regularly review and update policies to ensure they are in accordance with the latest laws and regulations. This includes conducting risk assessments and impact analyses to identify potential gaps or vulnerabilities.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for personnel involved in personal data processing to ensure they understand the policies and procedures in place. This includes training on data protection laws and regulations.
Maintain records of policy compliance, including documentation of training programs, policy reviews, and risk assessments. This will help demonstrate compliance with the policy and laws in place.

Develop a comprehensive compliance framework that outlines the procedures and processes for ensuring policy compliance. This includes establishing roles and responsibilities, reporting mechanisms, and incident response plans.

Regularly monitor and review policy compliance to ensure that personnel are adhering to the policies and procedures in place. This includes conducting audits and risk assessments to identify potential gaps or vulnerabilities.

extracted_data.article_text:

maternity benefits programme, while consenting to provide her personal data for the purpose
of availing of such benefits. Government may process the personal data of X processing to
determine her eligibility to receive any other prescribed benefit from the government;

legitimate uses.
extracted_data.requirement: Personal data shall be processed for legitimate purposes, including determining eligibility for government benefits.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Organizations must only process personal data for specific, legitimate purposes, such as determining eligibility for government benefits.

controls.control_title: Define Clear and Legitimate Purpose for Processing Personal Data
controls.control: Establish a clear and documented purpose for processing personal data, including determining eligibility for government benefits. This purpose must be specific, legitimate, and aligned with the organization's goals and objectives. Ensure that all stakeholders, including employees and third-party vendors, understand the purpose and scope of personal data processing.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs)
controls.control: Perform regular DPIAs to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing personal data for determining eligibility for government benefits. This includes assessing the likelihood and potential impact of data breaches, unauthorized access, or other security incidents.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate and Up-to-Date Records of Personal Data Processing
controls.control: Ensure that accurate and up-to-date records of personal data processing are maintained, including documentation of the purpose, scope, and duration of processing. This includes records of data subjects' consent, if applicable.

controls.control_title: Implement Access Controls and Authorization Procedures
controls.control: Implement access controls and authorization procedures to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, including data used to determine eligibility for government benefits. This includes implementing role-based access controls, password policies, and audit logs.

controls.control_title: Provide Transparency and Notice to Data Subjects
controls.control: Provide transparency and notice to data subjects about the processing of their personal data, including the purpose, scope, and duration of processing. This includes providing clear and concise information about the data subjects' rights and how to exercise them.

extracted_data.article_text:

of availing of such benefits. Government may process the personal data of X processing to
determine her eligibility to receive any other prescribed benefit from the government;

legitimate uses.
extracted_data.requirement: Personal data shall be processed for legitimate uses, such as determining eligibility for other government benefits.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Organizations must only process personal data for legitimate uses, such as determining eligibility for other government benefits.

controls.control_title: Define Clear Data Collection and Processing Purposes
controls.control: Establish a documented process to define the purposes for which personal data will be collected and processed. This includes identifying the specific government benefits for which eligibility will be determined. Ensure that data collection and processing purposes are legitimate, transparent, and communicated to individuals.

Implement data minimization practices to ensure that only the minimum amount of personal data necessary for determining eligibility for other government benefits is collected and processed. This includes avoiding the collection of excessive or unnecessary data.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular data protection impact assessments (DPIAs) to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with the processing of personal data for determining eligibility for other government benefits. This includes assessing the likelihood and potential impact of data breaches or unauthorized access.

controls.control_title: Provide Data Subject Access and Correction Rights
controls.control: Establish procedures for individuals to access and correct their personal data, as well as to request erasure or restriction of processing. This includes providing clear information on how to exercise these rights and responding to requests in a timely manner.

Implement robust data security measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction. This includes implementing encryption, access controls, and regular security audits.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must enter into a valid contract with the Data Processor that outlines the terms and conditions of data processing, including the scope of work, data protection obligations, and termination clauses.

The Data Fiduciary must conduct a thorough selection and approval process for the Data Processor, including assessing their data protection policies, procedures, and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.

The Data Fiduciary must clearly define the scope of data processing activities to be performed by the Data Processor, including the types of personal data to be processed, the purposes of processing, and the duration of processing.

The Data Processor must provide regular training and awareness programs for their employees and personnel involved in data processing, to ensure they understand their data protection obligations and responsibilities.
The Data Fiduciary must regularly monitor and audit the Data Processor's data processing activities to ensure they are complying with the terms of the contract and relevant laws and regulations.

The Data Fiduciary must have a clear plan in place for terminating the contract with the Data Processor, including procedures for data destruction, return of personal data, and notification of affected Data Principals.

controls.control: Implement data validation and verification mechanisms to ensure the completeness, accuracy, and consistency of personal data at the point of collection, processing, and transfer. This includes using data quality checks, data profiling, and data cleansing techniques to identify and correct errors or inconsistencies.

Establish a data quality monitoring and reporting process to regularly review and assess the completeness, accuracy, and consistency of personal data. This includes tracking data quality metrics, identifying trends and anomalies, and taking corrective action to address any issues.

Implement data standardization and normalization processes to ensure that personal data is consistent and accurate across different systems and applications. This includes using data mapping, data transformation, and data integration techniques to ensure data consistency.

Establish a data governance and stewardship framework to ensure that personal data is properly managed and maintained. This includes defining data ownership, data accountability, and data responsibility, as well as establishing data policies and procedures for data management.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation and records of personal data processing activities, including data collection, processing, and transfer. This includes keeping records of data quality checks, data validation, and data verification activities.

controls.control: Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access sensitive data and systems. This includes multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, and regular review and update of user permissions.

Conduct regular security audits to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the system. This includes penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and risk assessments to ensure that the system is secure and compliant with the Act and its rules.
Implement data encryption to protect sensitive data both in transit and at rest. This includes using secure protocols such as HTTPS and SSL/TLS, and encrypting data stored on servers and databases.

Develop an incident response plan to ensure that the organization is prepared to respond to security incidents and data breaches. This includes identifying incident response teams, developing incident response procedures, and conducting regular training and exercises.

Provide regular security awareness training to employees to educate them on security best practices and the importance of data protection. This includes training on password management, phishing, and other security-related topics.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of security-related activities, including security audits, incident response, and employee training. This includes maintaining records of access controls, user permissions, and security incident reports.

controls.control: Develop and maintain a comprehensive data protection policy that outlines the procedures for handling personal data, including data collection, storage, processing, and disposal. The policy should be communicated to all employees and contractors who handle personal data.

Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities and threats to personal data. This includes assessing the risks associated with data processing, storage, and transmission, as well as the risks associated with third-party vendors and contractors.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data. This includes implementing role-based access controls, password policies, and multi-factor authentication.

Use encryption to protect personal data both in transit and at rest. This includes encrypting data stored on servers, laptops, and mobile devices, as well as encrypting data transmitted over the internet.

Develop and implement an incident response plan to respond to personal data breaches. This includes procedures for detecting, containing, and reporting breaches, as well as procedures for notifying affected individuals and regulatory authorities.
Conduct regular security audits to ensure that security controls are in place and functioning as intended. This includes auditing access controls, encryption, and incident response procedures.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Backup and Recovery Procedures
controls.control: Implement data backup and recovery procedures to ensure that personal data can be recovered in the event of a disaster or system failure.
Provide regular data protection training to employees and contractors who handle personal data. This includes training on data protection policies, procedures, and best practices.

controls.control_title: Establish a Personal Data Breach Notification Policy
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall establish a clear policy outlining the procedures for notifying the Board and affected Data Principals in the event of a personal data breach. This policy shall be communicated to all employees and relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Designate a Personal Data Breach Notification Officer
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall designate a specific officer responsible for coordinating the notification process in the event of a personal data breach. This officer shall be responsible for ensuring timely and accurate notifications to the Board and affected Data Principals.

controls.control_title: Develop a Personal Data Breach Notification Template
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall develop a standardized template for notifying the Board and affected Data Principals in the event of a personal data breach. This template shall include essential information such as the nature of the breach, affected data, and recommended actions for the Data Principals.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Personal Data Breach Notifications
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all personal data breach notifications sent to the Board and affected Data Principals. This record shall include the date of notification, method of notification, and any subsequent actions taken.

controls.control_title: Establish a Communication Plan for Personal Data Breach Notifications
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall establish a communication plan outlining the manner and form in which notifications shall be made to the Board and affected Data Principals. This plan shall take into account the sensitivity of the data and the potential impact on the Data Principals.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Personal Data Breach Notification Procedures
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide regular training to employees on the procedures for notifying the Board and affected Data Principals in the event of a personal data breach. This training shall emphasize the importance of timely and accurate notifications.

controls.control: Establish a process to erase personal data upon receipt of a withdrawal of consent from the Data Principal. This process should include verification of the Data Principal's identity and confirmation of their request to delete their data.

controls.control: Implement an automated process to erase personal data upon receipt of a withdrawal of consent from the Data Principal. The Data Fiduciary shall maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all complaints, including the date of receipt, description of the complaint, and the outcome of the complaint.

controls.control_title: Obtain Explicit Consent from Parents or Lawful Guardians
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the parent or lawful guardian of a child or person with disability before processing their personal data. This consent must be obtained in writing, preferably through a signed agreement or contract, and must specify the purpose and scope of the data processing.

The Data Fiduciary must verify the authenticity of the parental or guardian consent obtained. This can be done by checking the identity of the consenting party, ensuring they have the authority to provide consent on behalf of the child or person with disability, and maintaining a record of the consent.

The Data Fiduciary must maintain a record of the parental or guardian consent obtained, including the date, time, and details of the consent. This record must be kept for a minimum of 5 years and made available to regulatory authorities upon request.

The Data Fiduciary must train its staff on the requirements for obtaining consent from parents or lawful guardians of children or persons with disabilities. This training must cover the purpose and scope of the data processing, the types of personal data involved, and the procedures for obtaining and verifying consent.

The Data Fiduciary must review and update its consent procedures regularly to ensure they remain effective and compliant with changing regulations. This review must be conducted at least annually and must involve input from relevant stakeholders, including staff, parents, and regulatory authorities.

controls.control: Implement age verification for user registration to ensure that children cannot create accounts. This can be done by requiring users to provide their date of birth and verifying their age through a third-party service or by using a geolocation-based age estimation method.

controls.control_title: Disable Tracking and Monitoring of Children
controls.control: Disable tracking and monitoring of children on the platform. This includes disabling the collection of personal data, cookies, and other tracking mechanisms that can be used to target children with advertising.

controls.control_title: Implement Parental Consent for Data Collection
controls.control: Implement parental consent for data collection on children. This includes obtaining explicit consent from parents or guardians before collecting any personal data from children, and providing parents with the ability to review and delete their child's data.

Use age-appropriate content filtering to prevent children from accessing mature or explicit content. This can be done through the use of content filters, rating systems, or other mechanisms that ensure children are only exposed to content that is suitable for their age.

controls.control_title: Provide Clear Information to Parents and Children
controls.control: Provide clear information to parents and children about data collection, tracking, and advertising practices. This includes providing a clear and concise privacy policy, as well as information about how to opt-out of tracking and advertising.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Data Collection Practices
controls.control: Regularly review and update data collection practices to ensure that they are compliant with the requirements of the Data Fiduciary. This includes reviewing data collection methods, tracking mechanisms, and advertising practices to ensure that they are not targeting children.

controls.control: The organization shall conduct regular risk assessments to identify and evaluate the risks associated with processing personal data of children. This assessment shall be conducted at least once a year and after any significant change in the processing activities.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: The organization shall implement data protection by design and default principles when processing personal data of children. This includes implementing technical and organizational measures to ensure that personal data is processed in a way that is secure, transparent, and compliant with the applicable laws and regulations.

The organization shall establish a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who shall be responsible for ensuring compliance with the applicable laws and regulations related to the processing of personal data of children. The DPO shall be responsible for conducting regular audits and risk assessments, and for implementing corrective actions as necessary.

controls.control_title: Provide Transparency to Children and Parents
controls.control: The organization shall provide transparency to children and parents about the processing of their personal data. This includes providing clear and concise information about the purposes of processing, the types of data collected, and the rights of children and parents to access and control their personal data.

The organization shall implement age verification mechanisms to ensure that children are not able to access or process their personal data without the consent of their parents or guardians. This includes implementing technical and organizational measures to verify the age of users and to restrict access to personal data accordingly.

The organization shall establish a breach notification process to ensure that any breach of personal data of children is promptly identified, contained, and notified to the relevant authorities and affected individuals. This includes establishing a process for conducting incident response and for notifying affected individuals and the relevant authorities in a timely and transparent manner.

controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who is responsible for overseeing the organization's data protection practices and ensuring compliance with relevant data protection regulations. The DPO shall be a senior-level employee with expertise in data protection and shall report directly to the highest level of management.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall define the DPO's responsibilities, including but not limited to, data protection risk assessment, data subject rights management, data breach notification, and compliance with data protection regulations. The DPO's responsibilities shall be documented in a written policy and communicated to all employees.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall ensure that the DPO operates independently and is not influenced by business or commercial considerations. The DPO shall have unfettered access to all data and systems, and shall be able to report directly to the highest level of management without fear of retribution.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall provide the DPO with the necessary training, resources, and budget to perform their duties effectively. This includes but is not limited to, training on data protection regulations, access to data protection tools and technologies, and participation in industry conferences and events.

controls.control_title: Review and Update the DPO's Role
controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall review and update the DPO's role and responsibilities on a regular basis to ensure that they remain effective and compliant with changing data protection regulations. This includes but is not limited to, reviewing the DPO's performance, updating the DPO's job description, and providing additional training and resources as needed.

controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall appoint an independent data auditor who meets the following criteria: (1) has relevant expertise in data auditing, (2) has no conflicts of interest with the Significant Data Fiduciary, and (3) is not subject to the Significant Data Fiduciary's control or direction.

The independent data auditor shall have relevant qualifications, experience, and certifications in data auditing, such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or Certified Data Privacy Professional (CDPP).

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall establish a formal process for appointing the independent data auditor, including a clear selection criteria, a transparent evaluation process, and a documented decision-making process.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall provide the independent data auditor with necessary training and support to ensure they have the necessary skills and knowledge to perform their duties effectively.

The independent data auditor shall provide regular reports to the Significant Data Fiduciary on their findings and recommendations, and shall communicate with the Significant Data Fiduciary in a timely and transparent manner.

The independent data auditor shall maintain their independence and objectivity throughout the audit process, and shall not be influenced by the Significant Data Fiduciary or any other party with a vested interest in the outcome of the audit.

controls.control_title: Establish a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) Policy
controls.control: Develop and implement a policy that outlines the requirements and procedures for conducting periodic DPIAs. The policy should include the frequency of DPIAs, the scope of the assessment, and the roles and responsibilities of personnel involved in the process.

controls.control_title: Identify and Document High-Risk Data Processing Activities
controls.control: Conduct a thorough risk assessment to identify high-risk data processing activities that require a DPIA. Document the results of the risk assessment, including the type of data processed, the purpose of the processing, and the potential risks associated with each activity.

controls.control_title: Develop a DPIA Template and Guidelines
controls.control: Create a standardized template and guidelines for conducting DPIAs. The template should include questions and prompts to help assess the risks associated with each data processing activity, and the guidelines should provide clear instructions on how to complete the assessment.

Provide training to personnel on the procedures for conducting DPIAs, including the use of the DPIA template and guidelines. Ensure that personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in the DPIA process.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular DPIA Review and Update
controls.control: Schedule regular reviews of completed DPIAs to ensure that they remain accurate and up-to-date. Update the DPIAs as necessary to reflect changes in data processing activities or new risks that have been identified.

Maintain accurate and complete records of all DPIAs, including the results of the assessment, the recommendations for mitigating risks, and the implementation of any recommended controls. Retain the records for a minimum of 5 years, as required by law.

extracted_data.requirement: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall conduct periodic audit.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Significant Data Fiduciary must regularly conduct audits to ensure compliance with this Act.

controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall conduct an annual audit of all data processing activities to ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards. The audit shall be performed by an independent third-party auditor and shall cover all aspects of data processing, including data collection, storage, transmission, and disposal.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall conduct a quarterly risk assessment to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities in data processing activities. The risk assessment shall be performed by a designated risk management team and shall include a review of all data processing systems, processes, and procedures.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall maintain accurate and complete records of all audits and risk assessments, including audit reports, risk assessments, and corrective action plans. The records shall be retained for a minimum of 7 years and shall be made available to regulatory authorities upon request.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall conduct regular compliance training for all employees involved in data processing activities to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining compliance with relevant regulations and standards. The training shall be provided at least annually and shall cover all aspects of data processing, including data protection, security, and confidentiality.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall establish an incident response plan to respond to data breaches and other security incidents. The plan shall be developed in consultation with regulatory authorities and shall include procedures for notification, containment, and remediation of incidents.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Subject Access Request (DSAR) Process
controls.control: Establish a clear and efficient process for handling DSARs, including procedures for verifying the identity of the data subject, responding to requests within the required timeframe, and providing access to the requested personal data in a format that is easily accessible to the data subject.

Ensure that data subjects have access to their personal data through a secure and user-friendly interface, such as a portal or a self-service platform, where they can view, update, and delete their personal data as needed.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Data Subject Requests
controls.control: Keep a record of all DSARs received, including the date and time of the request, the data subject's identity, the personal data requested, and the response provided. This record should be maintained for a minimum of 5 years and be easily accessible for auditing and compliance purposes.

Clearly communicate the data subject's rights to the organization's website, marketing materials, and other relevant channels, including the right to access, correct, and delete personal data, as well as the process for exercising these rights.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Data Subject Access Requests
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on the organization's DSAR process, including procedures for handling requests, verifying identity, and responding to data subjects. This training should be mandatory for all staff members who interact with personal data.

controls.control: Establish a clear and transparent process for handling DSARs, including a designated contact point for data subjects to submit their requests. This process should be communicated to data subjects through privacy notices and other relevant channels.

Provide data subjects with clear and concise information about their personal data, including the categories of data collected, the purposes of processing, and the recipients of their data. This information should be easily accessible and provided in a format that is easy to understand.

Obtain explicit consent from data subjects before collecting and processing their personal data. This consent should be informed, specific, and freely given, and should be documented and retained for a period of time as required by law.

controls.control_title: Data Subject Access to Third-Party Data
controls.control: Establish procedures for data subjects to access and correct their personal data held by third-party processors. This may involve providing data subjects with contact information for the third-party processor or establishing a process for data subjects to submit requests directly to the processor.

Establish a process for data subjects to request the erasure of their personal data, including procedures for verifying the request and deleting the data in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

extracted_data.article_text:

to a request made in writing by such other Data Fiduciary for the purpose of prevention or
